text: Locate a hearty saucepan, mixing bowl and a wire whisk. Don't forget about digging out measuring cups and spoons. Combine 1 cup of cold water with 1 envelope of Knox unflavored gelatin. Mix in saucepan but don't place over a flame. Allow the gelatin and water to sit for a few minutes before heating. Heat gelatin and water over low heat, stirring constantly. Simmer until gelatin is fully dissolved. Add 1/3 cup of canned pumpkin, ¼ cup of sugar and ¼ tsp. of pumpkin pie spice to simmering mixture. Continue to stir over low heat until the sugar has dissolved and the pumpkin has been integrated into the gelatin. The mixture should be smooth (like pumpkin pie consistency). Remove from heat and allow mixture to cool for approximately 30 minutes. Leave saucepan at room temperature as you don't want it to get cold, just remain warm. Combine ½ cup of vodka, 2 tablespoon (29.6 ml). butterscotch schnapps and ¼ cup of water in a separate bowl. Mix well. Add ½ tsp. of heavy cream to mixture and combine well. Integrate the liquor mixture into the waiting pumpkin pie mixture. Whisk well before pouring into the graham cracker crust pie shells. Chill pies and serve with whipped cream. Although store bought whipped cream is easy, making your own is too. Whisk heavy cream and sugar together until it forms a peak. Add a dollop and serve. Finished.
